properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 8:11PM CST until January 21 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in
Illinois...

Big Muddy River near Plumfield affecting Franklin and Williamson
Counties

...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in
Illinois...
Big Muddy River near Murphysboro affecting Jackson County

.The Big Muddy River at Plumfield is forecast to briefly fall below flood
stage Saturday, but will climb back above flood stage Sunday, reaching a
crest of 20.4 feet Monday. It will then fall back below flood stage Tuesday
afternoon. Murphysboro has crested, but will remain above flood stage at
least through the end of next week.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Big Muddy River near Plumfield.
* until Tuesday evening.
* At  7:30 PM Friday the stage was 20.2 feet.
* Flood Stage is 20.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will drop to a stage of 19.8 Saturday evening
and then will rise back above flood stage to a stage of 20.4 feet
by early Monday morning. The river will fall below flood stage Tuesday
early afternoon.
* Impact...At 20.0 Feet...Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly
bottomland and surrounding low lying areas.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
